paymentGateway.coreActivitiesTitle: TNCCPC’s (Tamil Nadu Citizen Consumer Protection Center) Core Activities
paymentGateway.coreActivitiesDescription: TNCCPC’s core activities encompass education, research, awareness campaigns, and advocacy. We forge partnerships with grassroots social organizations to bolster public participation, particularly among marginalized and underprivileged communities, in addressing socio-economic concerns, gender equality, and ecological sustainability.
paymentGateway.missionDescription: Our overarching mission aligns with the Government of Tamil Nadu’s commitment to ensuring equitable transactions in the purchase of goods and services within the state, upholding consumer rights for all.

Right to Safety.title: Right to Safety
Right to Safety.desc: The Right to Safety ensures that consumers are protected from goods and services that are hazardous to health or life.
additional: This right empowers consumers to demand safe products and practices.
It allows seeking compensation for harm caused by unsafe products.

Right to be Informed.title: Right to be Informed
Right to be Informed.desc: Consumers have the right to be informed about the products and services they purchase.
additional: Consumers should have clear and truthful information about products.
This prevents deceptive marketing and helps consumers make informed decisions.

Right to Choose.title: Right to Choose
Right to Choose.desc: Consumers have the right to choose from a range of products and services at competitive prices.
additional: This right ensures consumers can make choices without undue influence.
It protects consumers from monopolies and unfair market practices.

Right to be Heard.title: Right to be Heard
Right to be Heard.desc: Consumers have the right to voice their concerns and have them addressed.
additional: Consumers can lodge complaints with businesses or relevant authorities.
This right ensures that consumer feedback is taken seriously.

Right to Seek Redressal.title: Right to Seek Redressal
Right to Seek Redressal.desc: Consumers have the right to seek compensation for damages caused by unsafe or faulty products.
additional: This right helps consumers pursue justice when harmed by products or services.
It ensures that there are mechanisms in place for legal recourse.

Right to Consumer Education.title: Right to Consumer Education
Right to Consumer Education.desc: Consumers have the right to access information that helps them make informed choices.
additional: This includes information about their rights and how to make safe purchases.
Consumer education programs help raise awareness about safe practices and product knowledge.

breadcrumb.link: History of the Consumer Protection Act
breadcrumb.desc: Learn about the important legislation that protects consumers in India.

historyPage.heading: The Consumer Protection Act, 1986: A Milestone for Consumers

content.paragraph1: The Consumer Protection Act, 1986 (hereinafter referred to as the Act) is one of the benevolent social legislations intended to protect the large body of consumers from exploitation. The Act has come as a panacea for consumers all over the country and has assumed the shape of practically the most important legislation enacted in the country during the last few years. It has become the vehicle for enabling people to secure speedy and inexpensive redressal of their grievances.
content.paragraph2: With the enactment of this law, consumers now feel that they are in a position to declare "sellers beware," whereas previously, the consumers were at the receiving end and generally told "buyers beware."
content.keyProvisionsDesc: The Act postulates the establishment of the Central Consumer Protection Council and the State Consumer Protection Councils for the purpose of spreading consumer awareness. The Central Council is headed by the Minister-in-charge of Consumer Affairs in the Central Government, while at the State level, it is the Minister-in-charge of Consumer Affairs in the State Government who heads the State Council.
content.disputeRedressalDesc: To provide cheap, speedy, and simple redressal to consumer disputes, quasi-judicial machinery has been set up at each District, State, and National levels called District Forums, State Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission, and National Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission, respectively.
